alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; South Lincoln County; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Upper Green River Basin; Upper Green River Basin Foothills; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 8:35AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARK...TETON...SUBLETTE...LINCOLN AND FAR WESTERN FREMONT COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. At 831 AM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lake to 10 miles northwest of Togwotee Pass to 9 miles southeast of Lander Peak to 8 miles east of Randolph and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Lake around 835 AM MST. Daniel around 905 AM MST. Elkol around 910 AM MST. Diamondville around 915 AM MST. Kemmerer around 920 AM MST. Pinedale around 925 AM MST. Boulder, Opal, Half Moon Lake and Boulder Lake around 930 AM MST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
